remarks: Deduce a group from its properties.  Unlike ~ isgrpd2 , this one goes straight from the base properties rather than going through ` Mnd ` . ` N ` (negative) is normally dependent on ` x ` i.e. read it as ` N ( x ) ` .  (Contributed by NM, 6-Jun-2013.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 6-Jan-2015.)
statement:
isgrpd.b $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` G ) ) $.
isgrpd.p $e |- ( ph -> .+ = ( +g ` G ) ) $.
isgrpd.c $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B /\ y e. B ) -> ( x .+ y ) e. B ) $.
isgrpd.a $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B /\ z e. B ) ) -> ( ( x .+ y ) .+ z ) = ( x .+ ( y .+ z ) ) ) $.
isgrpd.z $e |- ( ph -> .0. e. B ) $.
isgrpd.i $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( .0. .+ x ) = x ) $.
isgrpd.n $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> N e. B ) $.
isgrpd.j $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( N .+ x ) = .0. ) $.
isgrpd $p |- ( ph -> G e. Grp ) $.
$d .+ x y z $.
$d .0. x y z $.
$d B x y z $.
$d G x y z $.
$d N y $.
$d ph x y z $.
